title: Template Reference Data — data_template_ref
text: dataset containing template input data rfs_get_species_list function.

title: Template Reference Data — data_template_ref
Template Reference Data — data_template_ref
text: data frame following columns: scientific_name_complete Complete scientific name species. scientific_name Scientific name without authorship. scientific_name_author Authorship scientific name including year. scientific_name_genus Genus scientific name. scientific_name_family Family scientific name. scientific_name_status Current status scientific name (e.g., "Valid", "Synonym", "Uncertain"). species_valid_name_complete Complete valid name species. species_valid_as_complete Valid name species synonym. species_valid_as_short Short valid name species (genus + epithet). species_valid_name_genus Genus valid name. species_valid_name_author Authorship valid name including year. species_valid_name_year Year valid species name. scientific_name_synonym_of Valid species synonym (genus + epithet). all_valid_species_complete valid species names associated scientific name. Separated semicolons. scientific_name_habitat Habitat information scientific name (e. g., "freshwater", "marine").

title: Template Reference Data — data_template_ref
text: Organized according taxonomic data Cichlidae

what: Download occurrence data for a specific area from GBIF — rfs_download_occ_data
title: Download occurrence data for a specific area from GBIF — rfs_download_occ_data
text: function downloads occurrence data specific area GBIF. Obs.: function unstable may work properly due time constraints server limitations downloading data. first execution work properly, please try rerun function using code. Alternatively, can use link, showed function execution, download data manually. IMPORTANT: return value function, data saved folder specified user.

title: Download occurrence data for a specific area from GBIF — rfs_download_occ_data
code: rfs_download_occ_data(   gbif_user,   gbif_pwd,   gbif_email,   country = "Brazil",   state = "Paraná",   taxonkey = 44,   user_polygon = NULL,   max_attempts = 10,   sleep_time = 120,   reverse_polygon = FALSE,   folder_name = "occ_data",   link = NULL )

title: Download occurrence data for a specific area from GBIF — rfs_download_occ_data
text: gbif_user GBIF username. gbif_pwd GBIF password. gbif_email GBIF email. country Country name. Default Brazil. state State name. Default Paraná. taxonkey GBIF taxonKey. Default Chordata (44). user_polygon User-defined polygon. Default NULL. max_attempts Maximum number download attempts. Default 10. sleep_time Sleep time download attempts. Default 120 s. reverse_polygon Logical. TRUE, polygon reversed. folder_name Folder name data saved. Default "occ_data". link Download link occurrence data. Default NULL.

title: Download occurrence data for a specific area from GBIF — rfs_download_occ_data
text: Downloaded occurrence data.

title: Download occurrence data for a specific area from GBIF — rfs_download_occ_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ rfs_download_occ_data(gbif_user = "gbif_user",   gbif_pwd = "gbif_pwd",   gbif_email = "gbif_email",   country = "Brazil",   state = "São Paulo") } # }

what: Get the species list from a dataframe based on rFishStatus template — rfs_get_species_list
title: Get the species list from a dataframe based on rFishStatus template — rfs_get_species_list
text: function uses dataframe scientific names organized list species names status.

title: Get the species list from a dataframe based on rFishStatus template — rfs_get_species_list
Get the species list from a dataframe based on rFishStatus template — rfs_get_species_list
text: df data frame based rFishStatus template (rFishStatus::data_template_ref).

title: Get the species list from a dataframe based on rFishStatus template — rfs_get_species_list
text: dataframe species list.

title: Get the species list from a dataframe based on rFishStatus template — rfs_get_species_list
code: df <- rFishStatus::data_template_ref df_list <- rfs_get_species_list(df) #> ℹ Creating species list from the input dataset. #> Looking for uncertain species. #> Looking for valid species. #> Looking for all previous valid species names. #> Filtering valid species. #> Checking for inconsistencies. #> Creating final dataset. #> Adding habitat information. #> ✔ Species list created successfully.

what: Check input list against a reference list and perform fuzzy matching — rfs_update_list
title: Check input list against a reference list and perform fuzzy matching — rfs_update_list
text: function takes input list reference list, performs series checks fuzzy matching operations create verified list. function checks input list data frame, column named "species", reference list data frame, reference list mandatory columns. also allows specifying method maximum distance fuzzy matching. function returns final data frame verified list.

title: Check input list against a reference list and perform fuzzy matching — rfs_update_list
code: rfs_update_list(   input_list,   reference_list,   complete_name = FALSE,   method = "lv",   max_dist = 3,   max_dist_2 = 5 )

title: Check input list against a reference list and perform fuzzy matching — rfs_update_list
text: input_list data frame representing input list checked. Must contain column named "species". Species name like genus + "sp." avoided. want use complete species names (genus + species authors + year) key, avoid using comma separate authors year, use space instead. example: 'Genus species Author 0000'. reference_list data frame representing reference list compare . obtained using rFishStatus::rfs_get_species_list(). complete_name logical value indicating whether use species + author + year nomenclature (please, avoid using comma year), TRUE, genus + epithet, FALSE, joining. Default FALSE. method method use fuzzy matching. Default "lv" (Levenshtein distance). max_dist maximum distance fuzzy matching. Default 3. user can change value according desired string distance; affect number matches false positives, vary according input list. cases 2 3 good values using species names, 4 5 using complete names. Please, check fuzzy matching results carefully. max_dist_2 maximum dostance deeper fuzzy matching. can keep "max_dist" increase 1 2. can improve query_species solving also increase false positives.

title: Check input list against a reference list and perform fuzzy matching — rfs_update_list
text: data frame containing final verified list.

title: Check input list against a reference list and perform fuzzy matching — rfs_update_list
code: input_list <- data.frame(    species = c("Acanthochromis polyacanthus", "Acanthochromis sp.", "Cichla kelberi", "Cichla piquitii",                "Cichla monocolos", "Cichla monoculus", "Cicla monoculus") ) reference_list <- rFishStatus::rfs_get_species_list(    rFishStatus::data_template_ref ) #> ℹ Creating species list from the input dataset. #> Looking for uncertain species. #> Looking for valid species. #> Looking for all previous valid species names. #> Filtering valid species. #> Checking for inconsistencies. #> Creating final dataset. #> Adding habitat information. #> ✔ Species list created successfully. checked_list <- rfs_update_list(input_list, reference_list) #> ℹ Joining data (exact matching) #> ℹ Fuzzy matching #> ℹ Creating verified list

title: Update occurrence data — rfs_update_occ_data
text: function checks occurrence data reference list update .

title: Update occurrence data — rfs_update_occ_data
Update occurrence data — rfs_update_occ_data
text: species_database Species database according rFishStatus template (see rFishStatus::data_template_ref). occurrence_df Occurrence dataframe obtained rFishStatus::rfs_download_occ_data(). family_names Family names used filtering occurrence dataframe. Default "auto". folder Folder name data saved. Default "data".

title: Update occurrence data — rfs_update_occ_data
text: Occurrence dataframe updated species names based reference dataset (see columns "ref" suffix) FishBase catalog (see columns "fb" suffix).

title: Update occurrence data — rfs_update_occ_data
code: rfs_update_occ_data(species_database = rFishStatus::data_template_ref,                     occurrence_df = occ_df) #> Error: object 'occ_df' not found
